title: Why we are spending so much money on our dogs - Pets
text:
We bake our dogs birthday cakes, buy them gifts, hire them personal trainers, push them in strollers, dress them up, and wear them in canine carriers on our chests.
Americans will spend more than $60 billion on our pets this year, more than triple what we spent in 1994, reports The Boston Globe .
Related Link Get today’s headlines right in your inbox Dog products run the gamut from your basic squeak toy to dog perfume, a prosthetic testicular implant for neutered dogs, and blow up dolls for your dog’s, ahem, carnal impulses.
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below Why do we buy these things? According to a Harris Poll survey, 96 percent of owners think of their dogs as members of the family. And so we are treating them as such, even spending considerable money on medical treatments like hip replacements and chemotherapy.
“People are willing to go this extra yard because they’re bonding so strongly with their pets,” Bob Vetere, president and CEO of the American Pet Products Association, told the Globe .
Read the full story in the Globe .
Boston-area kennels that pamper pets :
 At the Pooch Hotel, your pet will enjoy deluxe suites, fun play areas, a turn-down service complete with tummy rub, tooth brushing, a pawdicure, flat-screen TVs, and more. Enjoy 24/7 access to your pet while you’re aware via webcams. A standard suite costs $50, a presidential suite is $75, and a palace suite is $100. 285 Newtonville Ave., Newton. Pooch hotel At Muddy Creek Animal Care Center in Rowley, cats can sleep in four-poster beds in their own condo, enjoy play time, sunbathing, and TV time. Dogs enjoy cuddle time, extra treats, story time, and play time. This facility also boards ferrets and rabbits. Because rates vary based on individual pet needs, Muddy Creek prefers people call for rates. Muddy Creek Animal Care Center, 993 Haverhill St., Rowley. Muddy Creek Animal Care Center The Urban Houndis open and staffed 24 hours a day/ 365 days a year. It has a hospital-grade air filtration system, K-9 grass, an Urban Hound training classroom, and luxury sleep suites. Standard 4-foot by 6-foot suite costs $70 per night. Luxury 5-foot by 6-foot suite costs $85 per night. Daycare costs $36 per day. The Urban Hound is located at 129 Malden St. in Boston. The Urban Hound Chez Mieuxis for cats only. Cats stay in multi-level condos with a window view (the cats pictured are sharing a condo because they are from the same family). They can enjoy leisurely strolls, playtime with toys, and cuddle time with caregivers. Each condo costs $25 per night for one cat, $11 additional for a second cat, and $8 additional for a third cat. Chez Mieux is located at 81 Speen St., Floor 2, in Natick. Chez Mieux At Bond Luxury Kennels in Norwood, pets enjoy a “fluff and buff service,” wading pools, nightly tuck-ins, treats, sleep in luxury suites with customized beds, and they are walked five times a day. Webcams are available. Cats sleep in private condos with luxury beds and scratching posts. Luxury suites for dogs cost $45 per night. Cat condos cost $25 per day. The webcam rate is $10 per hour. Bond Luxury Kennels are located at 12 Carnegie Row in Norwood. Bond Luxury Kennels At Toureen Pet Resort & Spa, dogs listen to classical music and take strolls on the Riverwalk. Cats stay in condos and use an indoor gym. Schedules include play times and a turn-down nightly biscuit service. The rates are $41 to $69 per night for dogs based on your pet’s size and whether you reserve a suite. Pay for extras such as a 20-minute stroll along the Riverwalk, which costs $10. Cats cost $24 per night. Toureen Pet Resort & Spa, 380 Pleasant St., Watertown. Toureen Pet Resort & Spa At Red Dog Pet Resort & Spa in Boston, your pet can chill out in a private suite with a flat-screen TV. Cats enjoy custom-designed multi-level rooms with music, sunlight, and small bathrooms. Order extra play time and treats, purified water, and a bedtime tuck-in. Prices for dogs per night range from $40 for the petite suite to $85 for the presidential suite, plus fees for extra services such as $5 for “yappy time” and $10 for bedtime tuck-ins. Cat visits cost $22 per night. Red Dog Pet Resort & Spa is located at 274 Southhampton St. in Boston. Red Dog Pet Resort & Spa Fenway Barkon the oceanfront offers private condos with TV and Skype services, a splash pool, play groups, blueberry facials, massage, acupressure treatment, and indoor grass parks overlooking the ocean. The prices range from $59 for the “bleacher” suites to $103 per night for the “luxury box” suites. Services such as massage and facials cost extra. Fenway Bark is located at 370 W First St., South Boston. Fenway Bark
